meanings.definition: Capable of being transferred or conveyed to another person.
meanings.sent1: The toy was alienable, so I could give it to my friend.
meanings.sent2: The ticket was alienable, allowing me to pass it on to someone else.
meanings.sent3: I found an alienable cookie in the jar, so I shared it with my sister.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as alienable as a precious gem, easily passed from one person to another.
meanings.sent5: The alienable key unlocked the mystery box, ready to be handed to the next adventurer.

meanings.definition: Able to be given up or surrendered.
meanings.sent1: His alienable rights were willingly relinquished for the greater good.
meanings.sent2: The alienable land was offered as a peace offering.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly called her stubbornness an alienable trait, ready to be surrendered at any moment.
meanings.sent4: The alienable crown was laid down by the king, symbolizing his peaceful abdication.
meanings.sent5: The alienable flag was lowered in a sign of surrender, ending the conflict peacefully.

meanings.definition: Not permanent or inherent; able to be removed or changed.
meanings.sent1: The temporary tattoo was alienable, easily washed away with water.
meanings.sent2: His opinion was alienable, subject to change based on new information.
meanings.sent3: The alienable sticker on the laptop was a fun way to personalize it.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as alienable as the weather, constantly shifting throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The alienable paint on the wall allowed for easy redecoration whenever she felt like a change.
